ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend it if you are interested in ethnographic research and have the time to do it during the schoolyear.
This course is essential for anyone interested in conducting qualitative field research.

Yes, I would certainly recommend this course to my colleagues. I would summarize the course in this way: In this course you'll learn both the theory, ethics and practice of conducting rigorous field research, particularly interviews and doing participant observation. You will do so with one of the best qualitative researchers in political science today, Prof. Wood, who also happens to be a wonderful teacher. Be prepared to work a lot, though!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It helped give me direction for the future.

This course provided a solid grounding in qualitative methods. It provided an opportunity to practices these methods. It also provided the opportunity to think deeply about the theoretical contributions that qualitative research can make. I will use these lessons directly in my own research.
This is a key course for me as I gain the skills to conduct my own qualitative field research for my dissertation and other projects.
